member.name: T:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions
member.summary: string extensions for card values

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.GetLuhnCheckDigit(System.String)
member.summary: Algorithm 1. Append a zero check digit to the number and calculate checksum 2. If the (sum mod 10) == 0, then the check digit is 0 3. Else, the check digit = 10 - (sum mod 10)

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.IsLuhnDigitCorrect(System.String)
member.summary: Checks that the Luhn digit is correct on the supplied number.
member.returns: true if Check Digit is correct

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.FactorLuhnDigit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starting with the first digit multiply every other by 2. If result is greater than 9 set it to the sum of the digits or subtract 9 Zero based list 0 = 1, 1 = 2 etc. so to test for even we test for odd.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.GetEanCheckDigit(System.String)
member.summary: Multiplies every other digit by 3 2. If the (sum mod 10) == 0, then the check digit is 0 3. Else, the check digit = 10 - (sum mod 10)

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.IsEanDigitCorrect(System.String)
member.summary: Checks that the Luhn digit is correct on the supplied number.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.FactorEanDigit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starting with the first digit multiply every other digit by 3 starting with the first one. Zero based list 0 = 1, 1 = 2 etc. so to test for even we test for odd.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.ValidateNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Well, it kind of validates that it is a number!

member.summary: Calculates the check digit.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.StringExtensions.EscapeUriDataStringRfc3986(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a string according to the URI data string rules given in RFC 3986.
member.remarks: The method is supposed to take on RFC 3986 behavior if certain elements are present in a .config file. Even if this actually worked (which in my experiments it doesn't), we can't rely on every host actually having this configuration element present.
